file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-51-08-04 - FLAP FLEXIBLE SHAFT SECTION 5 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLAP FLEXIBLE SHAFT SECTION 5 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install section 5 of the flap flexible shaft. B. Section 5 of the flap flexible shaft (FFS) extends from the flap transmission brake to the actuator installed at the tip of the flap outboard panel. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FLAP FLEXIBLE SHAFT SECTION 5 - RE- ALL 27-51-08-000-801-A MOVAL FLAP FLEXIBLE-SHAFT SECTION 5 - IN- ALL 27-51-08-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-51-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-51-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FLAP FLEXIBLE SHAFT SECTION 5 - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove section 5 of the flap flexible shaft. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS AMM TASK 57-56-01-000-801-A/400 - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 5711 Wing trailing edge 6711 Wing trailing edge D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing trailing edge I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THERE ARE NO PERSONS OR EQUIPMENT IN THE FLAP TRAVEL AREA. (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with an external DC-power supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Set the flaps to the 45-degree position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-51-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) On the circuit breaker panel, open the FLAP 1 and FLAP 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (5) Open the lower shroud of the outboard flap (AMM TASK 57-56-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Cut the lockwire (1) that safeties FFS section 5 (2) in the flap transmission brake (3). (2) Cut the lockwire (1) that safeties the FFS section 5 (2) in the actuator (7) installed at the tip of the outboard flap (8). (3) Loosen the FFS section 5 (2) from the flap transmission brake (3). (4) Loosen the FFS section 5 (2) from the actuator installed at the tip of the outboard flap (8). (5) Loosen the FFS supports (4) to remove the FFS section 5 (2) from spar ΙΙ. (6) Remove FFS section 5 (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-51-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Flap Flexible-Shaft Section 5 - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE B D 541 C A 8. OUTBOARD FLAP FFS SECTION 5 A ZONE INBOARD FLAP 641 (REF.) DET. A 9. O-RING 1. LOCKWIRE 7. FLAP ACTUATOR TYPE A END 1 DET. B 1. LOCKWIRE 2 2. FFS SECTION 5 9. O-RING TYPE B END 4. FFS SUPPORT 1 FFS SECTION 4 (REF.) 5. WASHER 6. PIN 3. FLAP TRANSMISSION BRAKE DET. D 1 TORQUE: 19.2 - 25 N.m (170 - 221 lb.in) DET. C 2 YOU CAN INSTALL THE ENDS OF THE FFS IN TWO DIRECTIONS. BUT WE RECOMMEND THAT YOU INSTALL THE TYPE-A END OF FFS SECTION 5 TO THE FLAP ACTUATOR, AND THE TYPE-B END OF FFS SECTION 5 TO THE FTB. EM145AMM270862A.DGN THUS, GREASE WILL NOT GET INTO THE FTB. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-51-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FLAP FLEXIBLE-SHAFT SECTION 5 - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install section 5 of the flap flexible shaft. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 27-51-00-700-801-A/500 FLAP CONTROL SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 27-53-04-700-801-A/500 FLAP ZERO-DEGREE RIGGING INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS AMM TASK 57-56-01-400-801-A/400 - INSTALLATION IPC 27-51-00 FLAP MECHANICAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 5711 Wing trailing edge 6711 Wing trailing edge D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 27-51-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing trailing edge EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-51-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: • You can install the ends of the FFS in two directions • But we recommend that you install the type-A end of FFS section 5 to the flap actuator, and the type-B end of FFS section 5 to the FTB. Thus, grease will not get into the FTB. (1) Before you install FFS section 5, replace the O-ring (9). Refer to (Figure 401). (2) Coat the new O-ring (9) with a thin film of Parker Super-O-Lube lubricant before the assembly. (3) Install the type-A end of FFS section 5 (2) to the actuator (7) installed at the tip of the outboard flap (8) and safety it. NOTE: The type-A end of the FFSs is identified by a red label. Clean the FFSs to see the label if required. (4) Install the type-B end of FFS section 5 (2) to the flap transmission brake (3) and safety it. NOTE: Make sure that the shaft is inserted fully, before you lockwire the nut. (5) Put FFS section 5 (2) in the supports (4) at spar ΙΙ. (6) Tighten the supports (4). Use the pin (6) and washer (5). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the lower shroud of the outboard flap (AMM TASK 57-56-01-400-801-A/400). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close the FLAP 1 and FLAP 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (3) Do the operational check of the flap control system ( AMM TASK 27-51-00-700-801-A/ 500). (4) If the FFS replacement is because of shaft rupture or twist, do the flap-zero degree rigging ( AMM TASK 27-53-04-700-801-A/500).
